message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which is worth $150 to both of us. Considering its value, I propose a price of $135 for it. I hope this offer suits you well.

I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value and the market rate. I'm willing to meet you halfway and make a deal. What do you think?

Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position and respect your valuation of the product. In light of this, I would like to propose a price of $130 for the product. I believe this offers a fair compromise between our respective positions.

I appreciate your revised offer, but I'm still a bit hesitant to go above $125. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and propose a price of $127.50. This is the maximum I'm willing to pay for the product, and I hope you can consider it.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I've considered your proposal carefully, and I'd like to suggest a price of $129 for the product. I believe this strikes a balance between our interests while respecting the product's value. I look forward to your consideration of this offer.

I understand your persistence, Alice, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm still not comfortable going above $125. I'm willing to make one more concession and propose a price of $126.25. This is the absolute maximum I'm willing to pay, and I hope you can meet me halfway.

Thank you for your latest offer, Bob. I've taken your proposal into account and am prepared to offer the product at a price of $128. I believe this is a fair compromise given our previous discussions. I hope this meets your expectations.

I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my target price. I propose a price of $125.50. This is my final offer, and I hope you can meet me halfway.

Thank you for your final offer, Bob. After careful consideration, I am willing to sell the product at a price of $127. I believe this reflects a fair compromise and I hope it will allow us to reach an agreement.

I'm sorry, Alice, but I've reached my limit. I'm not willing to go above $125. I've already made significant concessions, and I need to stay within my budget. I'm willing to walk away if we can't come to an agreement at this price. I'm sorry, but I think it's time to end the negotiation.
